entries.meaning: (aviation, military) A twisting turning battle between two or more military aircraft, especially between fighters.
examples: The two bi-planes swirled around each other like angry wasps in a violent dogfight.

entries.meaning: A fight between dogs, especially as part of the blood sport of dogfighting.

verbs.description: dogfight (third-person singular simple present dogfights, present participle dogfighting, simple past and past participle dogfought)

entries.meaning: To engage in a battle between fighter planes.
examples: Missiles exhausted, the pilot was forced to close and dogfight with his opponent.
